result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Branden J. Cloud was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Branden J. Cloud

Transcript of sentencing on revocation hearing, February 12, 2021
State's ltr to Judge Winton dated 5-14-21.pdf
Letters from DOC staff to Court regarding sentence credit granted
REVOKED - SENTENCED TO PRISON

1:54PM  Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County.  Defendant Branden J. Cloud in court, appearing by video, in custody, from Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Christian J Ness appearing by telephone.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances by telephone/video through zoom due to the Supreme Court Order regarding the Public Health Crisis of COVID-19.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court addresses DEF on right to a personal appearance.  DEF waives his right to personal appearance.  Court finds the DEF freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waived his right to personal appearance.  Court indicates receipt of sentencing on revocation packet.  State indicates receipt and review of revocation packet and summary, with no corrections.  Atty Ness indicates receipt and review of revocation packet and summary, with no corrections.  State indicates compliance with victim's rights.  State recites maximum sentences and Agents recommendations, reviews criminal complaint/facts, indicates 2 additional unresolved cases (Sauk and Shawano county) in the State of WI.  DEF makes a statement indicating a discrepancy.  State continues, indicating information he relayed was obtained from CCAP.  State recites Agent recommendations/statement. State joins with recommendation of the Agent and makes a recommendation of 2 years initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision, consecutive to Jackson County 16CF116.  State indicates 474 days of credit and $2625.81 of unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered.  DEF is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration program due to his age, but is eligible for substance abuse program.  

2:08PM OFF THE RECORD to allow Atty Ness time to meet with DEF.  2:10PM BACK ON THE RECORD - Atty Ness makes note of Branden's interjection regarding pending case in Shawano County, indicating this is DEF son, who has the same name.  Atty Ness argues sentence, requesting 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, but concurrent to Jackson County 16CF116, rather than consecutive.  DEF makes a statement prior to sentencing.  

Court addresses all parties, summarizing facts.  

Court imposes sentence of 4 years, bifurcated, 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Atty Ness stipulates to 474 days of credit.  State indicates 474 days of credit.  Court indicates 474 days of credit.  Court indicates this sentence will be consecutive to Jackson County case 16CF116.  Court will prepare written determinate sentence, detailing Bad Time provision.  DEF will have specified conditions while on extended supervision.  Based on DEF's age, he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration program , but is eligible for the substance abuse program.      Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered.
to Produce Transport
Proposed Order to Produce
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 12, 2021 at 01:45 pm.

2:00 pm.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court by phone.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Time set for sentencing after revocation hearing.   OFF THE RECORD discussion: DE does not appear, is in custody in the Sauk County Jail and Atty Ness states he has had trouble communicating with the DE because of facility rules and Atty Ness wishes to reset hearing and have the DE transported if possible, needs to contact the jail to discuss options. If he is unable to faciliate he will travel to the jail.    2:07 pm ON THE RECORD:  Court sets the record, recaps off the record discussion.  Sentencing after revocation is rescheduled.  Bond continues.   Atty Ness will keep the court and State updated as far as need for writ and/or Zoom scheduling.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 12, 2021 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Branden J. Cloud in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea questionaire proffered to court. Court addresses DEF.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Court finds there is a factual basis to count 1. 
DEF pleads guilty. Court accepts plea. Court orders PSI. Agent need not appear. 
OFF the Record for scheduling. DEF counsel requests modification of bond.
ON the record- Atty Chapman requests bond modification. Makes argument. State argues against.
Court reinstates bond (forfeiture was improvident) and modifies cash bond to $ 500.00  w/conditions: 1) curfew-in home between 9:00 PM and 6:00 AM  2)  Absolute Sobriety  3) Absolutely no driving of any motor vehicles 4) Contact DOC to set up time for PSI meeting 5) May not be on the premises of any establishment that serves or sells alcoholic beverages 6) No drugs without a prescription 7) No firearms including cross-bow, compound bow, etc.

Combined Cases (15CF271, 15CF123, 15CF14)    SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing.
